metadata.synopsis: The player finds Rakath Glitterbeard, head banker, and his cronies gathered around a chest congratulating one another on a trap well-sprung. The chest is a mimic, which they've used to capture and kill the crime boss The Stone Lord - or so they believe.The mimic bursts apart from the inside to reveal that the Stone Lord is none other than Minsc - and he's in the thrall of the Absolute. A doppelganger cultist is imitating his old friend Jaheira in an attempt to control him.

12.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player enters a wide chamber in utter disarray, as if recently ransacked. Unaware of the party, several fearful clerks are speaking in hushed tones around a large chest.

64.speaker: Cashguard Artillerist Loretta
64.context: CinematicNodeContext: Close up of chest - revealing mimic's distinctive eyes and teeth.

27.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
27.text: Hush your fussing. Nine-Fingers had this one made especially - that little mouthful will barely slow it down.
27.context: CinematicNodeContext: Unconcerned, Rakath takes out a smoking pipe, and sprinkles some tobacco in.NodeContext: JLatino: Get alts with and without the pipe in mouth, deliver the version with a pipe

4.speaker: Cashguard Artillerist Loretta
4.context: CinematicNodeContext: Rathgard pauses, not remembering where he placed his matches.NodeContext: JLatino: Get alts with and without the pipe in mouth, deliver the version with a pipe

14.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
14.text: Stories. Tall tales and big names, lad - don't let them fool you.
14.context: CinematicNodeContext: Rakath pats around his pockets looking for his matches.NodeContext: JLatino: Get alts with and without the pipe in mouth, deliver the version with a pipe

31.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
31.text: Elminster the archmage. Drizzt the drow exile. Heroes have power, aye - but not half so much as we do.
31.context: CinematicNodeContext: Slow zoom in on mimic as its shaking picks up pace while Rakath speaks.NodeContext: JLatino: Get alts with and without the pipe in mouth, deliver the version with a pipe. (Elminster = el-MIN-ster; Drizzt = DRIZT)

59.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
59.text: A little coin into the right purse. A soft word in the right ear. It's not glory that spins these planes, lad - it's gold.
59.context:
CinematicNodeContext: The mimic practically BOUNCES - then stills, and lets out a short, sharp BURP.

Rakath, satified, snaps his fingers, casting the Produce Flame cantrip, and a candle flame appears over his fingers.

He lights the pipe as he delivers his line.NodeContext: JLatino: Get alts with and without the pipe in mouth, deliver the version with a pipe

75.context: CinematicNodeContext: Minsc's fat fist bursts from inside the mimic, teeth fly. Rakath squawks in alarm.

73.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
73.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Reaction shot on Rakath as he takes a step back to avoid the pool of blood flowing from the mimic toward his feet.

The pipe drops from his mouth.NodeContext: Moradin = MO-ra-din. Retake of line needed - breathless and fearful. You thought for sure the man you trapped was dead and done with, but he just tored his way free with his bare hands

30.context: CinematicNodeContext: The mimic falls forward, the lid straining to stay shut, Minsc emerges peeling back the rows of teeth. Standing to his full height, the beloved ranger snaps the jaws of the mimic, its tongue flapping. The creature goes limp and Minsc allows it to thump to the ground.

39.speaker: Minsc
39.text: There is no gold in here.
39.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking down at mimic, then up at Rakath.NodeContext: TarikS: starting position 45 degree left, hands up stretching, turns right to look down at mimic then face forward

57.speaker: Minsc
57.text: If there is one thing Minsc hates more than beasts with bad breath -
57.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Minsc leans in close to Rakath's face. He stops his line, distracted.

The mimic's tongue starts moving at Minsc's feet, the monster is regaining conciousness.

50.speaker: Minsc
50.text: - it is those who are tricksome with the truth.
50.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Minsc gathers the tongue up in a bear-hug and then turns, hammer-throwing the mimic across the room. 

He turns back to Rakath, breathing hard.NodeContext: Effort for throwing, then line

0.speaker: Minsc
0.text: And turnips. But you are no turnip. Let that be of comfort, in your final moments.
0.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Briefly considering, then raising his sword to strike.NodeContext: <TarikS> holding sword with two hands.
Briefly considering, then raising his sword to strike. Brief break in intensity on the this whole line - delivered in almost a friendly fashion, as he believes it actually SHOULD be of comfort.

63.speaker: Jaheira
63.text: Meet Minsc. He still seems very much himself to me.
63.context: CinematicNodeContext: Preparing to step out an intervene.

53.speaker: Karlach
53.text: Oh my gods. I'm gonna faint!
53.context: NodeContext: Seeing Minsc for the first time (she's a fangirl).

35.speaker: Lae'zel
35.text: Minsc?! The same Minsc Jaheira's been looking for?

42.speaker: Shadowheart
42.text: Minsc? The very man Jaheira is after.

65.speaker: Astarion
65.text: That's the Minsc Jaheira's been searching for? Good gods...

36.speaker: Wyll
36.text: Minsc? Then the great hero is here!

54.speaker: Gale
54.text: Minsc - the very same Jaheira seeks.

32.speaker: Karlach
32.text: Is that... the Beloved Ranger? Jaheira is gonna burst! I'm gonna burst. Oh my gods - Minsc!
32.context: NodeContext: Excited, but to the player rather tahn shouted out.

67.speaker: Player
67.text: Wait, Jaheira. He doesn't seem in any state to listen.

51.speaker: Jaheira
51.context: CinematicNodeContext: Makes as if to step out, but stops short at next voice.

52.context: CinematicNodeContext: Minsc was hefting his sword to attack, but stalls at a voice from the podium.

18.speaker: Jaheira
18.context: NodeContext: Reacting with utter shock at what she sees

72.context: CinematicNodeContext: From the vaults at the back of the room, an elf step steps into view. Jaheira, identical down to the last grey hair. She is spattered with blood.

70.speaker: Jaheira
70.text: Stone Lord? Better to call yourself Stone-Head.

37.speaker: Minsc
37.text: Your false face does not fool my eyes. I will cut until you look like the monster you truly are.
37.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking to the fake-Jaheira, then back at the real Jaheira, furious.

1.speaker: Jaheira
1.text: ...Somehow, you are making even less sense than usual.

66.context: CinematicNodeContext: Minsc was hefting his sword to strike, but stalls at a voice from the podium.

15.text: The Stone Lord sees through your lies, shapeshifter. Count yourself lucky he cannot stay.

6.text: Nine-Fingers set a poor trap, little banker. Let the Absolute's faithful show you how it is done.
6.context: CinematicNodeContext: Raising voice to address Rakath / bankers. [TBD: Some cine-friendly gesture here to imply she's just killed a bunch of people. Holding up bloodied knife?]NodeContext: <TarikS> holding Knife with the right hand

76.context: CinematicNodeContext: At her gesture, portions of the floor / wall shimmer with VFX. Cultists step through as if passing through water - using Meld With Stone to launch their own ambush.

10.text: Now come, Stone Lord. We have the gold - and the Absolute has need of it elsewhere.

21.speaker: Minsc
21.context: CinematicNodeContext: Beat as Minsc fights his rage - then relents and turns to Jaheira's doppel. He trots to Jaheira's side and the portal winks shut behind them, leaving us alone with cultists and clerks.

5.speaker: Jaheira
5.text: Stlarning shapechangers. Enough! Let us deal with these cultists - then find out where they are nesting.
5.context: CinematicNodeContext: Furious, begins to curse but reins herself in and refocuses.NodeContext: Stlarning = stuh-LARN-ing (a polite equivalent of "f*cking")

9.speaker: Lae'zel
9.text: Stealing your ally is one thing. Stealing your face? An ignoble act by any estimation.

56.speaker: Shadowheart
56.text: First they take her friend, then they steal her face. Some people just don't understand boundaries...

74.speaker: Astarion
74.text: First they take Jaheira's friend and then they take her face? Oh she's going to hate that.

44.speaker: Wyll
44.text: First, they took Minsc. Now, they take Jaheira's face. Does their malice have no limit?

29.speaker: Gale
29.text: Stealing someone's friend and their face? Boundaries clearly mean little to this lot.

40.speaker: Karlach
40.text: They stole her friend and her face. Damn, that's low.

24.speaker: Halsin
24.text: They have taken both Jaheira's friend and her face. Their gall knows no bounds.

71.speaker: Minsc
71.context: CinematicNodeContext: Minsc turns to see player/Jaheira step into view.

38.speaker: Minsc
38.text: The Absolute has shown me your face, villain. I will beat it into a more pleasing shape.
38.context: CinematicNodeContext: Getting ready to attackNodeContext: <TarikS> Getting ready to attack with a two handed sword

16.text: Enough play, Stone Lord. The Absolute has other plans for this one.
16.context: CinematicNodeContext: Minsc was hefting his sword to strike, but stalls at a voice from the podium.
